text:
I built mod_jk using the Makefile.linuk with modified OS. Additionally, I have
removed the inclusion of sys/select.h from jk_global.h. Everything built without
errors then.

When I tried to load the module in Apache, I get the following output:

/usr/local/httpd/bin/apachectl start
/usr/lib/dld.sl: Unresolved symbol: dlclose (code)  from
/usr/local/httpd/libexec/mod_jk.so
/usr/lib/dld.sl: Unresolved symbol: dlopen (code)  from
/usr/local/httpd/libexec/mod_jk.so
/usr/lib/dld.sl: Unresolved symbol: dlerror (code)  from
/usr/local/httpd/libexec/mod_jk.so
/usr/lib/dld.sl: Unresolved symbol: dlsym (code)  from
/usr/local/httpd/libexec/mod_jk.so
Syntax error on line 8 of
/usr/local/lib/jakarta/jakarta-tomcat/conf/mod_jk.conf-auto:
Cannot load /usr/local/httpd/libexec/mod_jk.so into server: Unresolved external
/usr/local/httpd/bin/apachectl start: httpd could not be started


I do not know whether the module should work on HP-UX or if my build if correct
with my modifications.

If you need additional information, please contact me.
creator: brightice@brightice.de

text:
This won't be addressed in Tomcat 3.2.2 but will be evaluated for a later 
release.
creator: marc.saegesser@apropos.com

text: It's a build problem, not a bug.
creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com

text:
Hard to reproduce ( no hp/ux available for most people ), and is probably a 
specific build problem. Try to find out where dlopen is defined and include the 
library ( if apache is built with .so support it should have it !). Or maybe
hpux has a different name for dlopen library.
creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
brightice@brightice.de
text:
Created attachment 99
patch against 3.2.1 final using diff -urN

creator: brightice@brightice.de
text: The attached attachment compiles for me on HP-UX 11 using HP ansic.

creator: christian.hettler@asknet.de
text:
PHSS_22514 s700_800 11.00 ld(1) and linker tools cumulative patch
resolves the problem
